title: NYMIE
author: NYMIE
content: What can I do to be able to contribute to the forum?Is it by reporting fraud, cheating, plagiarism or do I have to make a good post so I can be called "your contribution is great on the forum". I read a lot of posts suggesting contributing to the forum and making good posts.I've been frequenting every available board on this bitcoin forum in the past few days and I came across a post about the types of bitcoin account ratings. Turns out I was very low-ranked.It occurred to me that I would challenge myself to be in the highest rank someday in a good and right way even though I only worked as a housemaid.

comments.author: _BlackStar
comments.body: Learn about bitcoin and have a great knowledge about it and you can share it with users in forum. You don't have to be a cheater hunter, spam buster or plagiarist to get merit and rank up, it's something you can probably do while focusing on your bitcoin learning.I'm not against your interest, but when you really learn about bitcoin and understand a lot about it then rest assured that people will see you as a different and interesting person. Merit and rank will be guaranteed not because you can caught most cheater or plagiarist, it's because you have something worthy of the forum.

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: You do not need to report fraud, cheating or plagiarism, but if you suspect that someone has committed any of these, please report it, because in that way you will help to keep this site a safe place for everyone. However, there are many other ways to contribute positively to the forum besides reporting violations. The most effective way is through creating good posts in response to others' questions and statements .This is how I think it works. All you do is be an active member of the forum and "contribute to the forum" as you call it. As for a good post, treat this place like your own community. So make posts that you think benefit others here in the community. It does not have to be something it really benefits us as long as people can learn from it or you are also learning from it at the same time or vice versa. After all, it is not helpful if your post doesn't add anything new to the discussion.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: You just have to be smart, learn more about quality posts and know more about quality posters on this forum. You can see quality posts on bitcoin boards, economy, trading, scam accusations, reputation and some other boards. You just have to learn, read more of what quality posters are posting on the boards you have interest in.This is just a community to learn and contribute, you have to do the two (learning and contributing) to be able to rank up. It might seem hard, but just for beginners, old members do not see it hard anymore. Once you start to get acquainted with this forum, you will see yourself having merits and ranking up. But you have to look properly into what others are posting, trying to be like them, and even looking for ways to be better.

comments.author: yahoo62278
comments.body: Those that get recognized the most are those that weren't really looking for any sort of recognition in the 1st place. Everyone is always in a hurry to make a name for themselves on here, why? You start out as a newbie for a reason. You need to take the time to read all the sticky threads and learn the rules. Once you're familiar, then you'll know what is and is not acceptable around here. The whole time you are familiarizing yourself with the forum and its rules you can also be contributing by sharing your knowledge about certain subjects on the forum. Maybe you are a coder or a miner or some other technical guy who can help users out that may have questions. Maybe you are a marketing whiz or a site owner (casino or something) and want to get knowledge from the community to better your project. Maybe alot of things. Just hang out and help out where you can.

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: Quote from: NYMIE on October 27, 2022, 08:05:31 PMIt occurred to me that I would challenge myself to be in the highest rank someday in a good and right way even though I only worked as a housemaid.Change doesn't happen in a day. It happens incrementally, or in this case, every two weeks - even if you get hundreds of merit today, you still need to wait 1 year to get enough activity to become a Hero Member, and for Legendary it's anywhere from 2-3 years (the exact amount is random for each user).
